intro: Buchnera symoensiana, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of South America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its showy yellow flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils at high elevations. It has a short stem with basal leaves that are palmately lobed. Buchnera symoensiana is often found in open grasslands and among shrubs in its native habitat.
